column4: Where should I go for a question regarding an external hard drive?
are they very small files?
No, they're mostly 700Mb .avi files
what file system?
fat32
that is strange, you should check the drive, but best do it under windows
I don't have access to a Windows system to check it on
This is a single boot Ubuntu system. I'd format the drive, but I don't have space to back up what's on it onto the laptop
can you access every directory fine?
Yes, and I've checked the directories, there is definitely no more than 101Gb of files in them, total, and no hidden files
you can try fsck.vfat
How would I do that?
man fsck.vfat will give you the useage
Would I just type "man fsck.vfat" into a terminal, or what? Sorry, I'm not very familiar with fsck
yes, if you type "man fsck.vfat" and press enter in the terminal it will give you a manual page for it
your command will look something like fsck.vfat -a /dev/DEVICE NAME
sorry it will be "sudo fsck.vfat -a /dev/..."
Yeah, I assumed I'd need SU priveliges to carry out a fsck
It says the device is mounted at /media/DEVICE NAME, do I still want to look for it in /dev/ or just use the /media mount point?
you want to unmount it first, and then do /dev/...
i'm leaving, hopefully this will help
